p: Please do forgive my not writing lately. I simply must write more often and I shall.
The bread did arrive, Mama, and is delicious, but due to the way it was sent it come a little crushed so next time you'd better put it in a box. I do like it so very
much - it seems like a part of home and makes my lunches much much better.

We've been rehearsing almost every day including Sundays from 2:00 till around 6:00. Yesterday Madame told us our czards (Jessie, Sylvia, and I) was very nice, and told me I am going to be lovely in the

Moskovsky (?) waltz (my solo). Today I have rehearsal alone on that. I do so hope recital will go over very well. WE're all doing and are going to do our doggondest to make that happen. I do hope that you can come to see recital. Couldn't you
come back with Sig? Oh! that would be grand.
How long a zipper do you need? The one on my blue tutu is only about 6 in. Should it be longer?
It's swell that Sig could go home. Too bad he's so blue though. I do so hope things get better for him - Daddy can help him
Hilda looks marvelous and is really quite happy again. Everyone loves her hair; I think I'll get mine cut too. I'll ask Madame what she thinks.
Mama, the bust looks simply marvelous. Everyone here thinks it is wonderful - and it certainly is Daddy
You should be greatly greatly happy over it, because it certainly is a master piece. We can hardly wait to see the large pictures of it. You look so happy in the picture too - just as you should be.
It's been glorious weather here - quite, that is, very hot,
at times, but beautiful anyway. It must be gorgeous at home now. How often I've wished I could jump in our crystal Roark pool.
That is marvelous about Jed Smith. I can hardly wait to read it all, Daddy. I've played over your record so often that I know both "April Theology" and

"And the Little Wind" by heart. Oh! they are so perfectily beautiful and absolutely meaningful - if you can understand my expressions. I've quoted these and others to several people a certain fitting times and they are simply struck by the combined beauty and directions of meaning. They are a great help
to me, and reciting them is such a thrill.
Recital is next Tuesday, June 10th, dress rehearsal is Saturday. We've been busy getting fittings at the costumers as well as rehearsing.
I got a letter from Nakanawa explaining the council ring ceremonies and ask-
ing me to write them "my" plan for what might be interesting. I'm going to write a complete account to them very soon.
So you're not going West tell Fall? Maybe things will be better that way anyway. Do you think you might get to drive
to Nakanawa?
Eny called yesterday. I must call her very soon again. We've had loads of fun out there, and Eny is very well so is Ollie.
I must go to rehearsal soon now. Loads of things are yet to be done in getting
ready for our big event.
Please do be happy - don't be "heartsick" as you say, Mama when I don't write. I simply must not put it off anymore.
West riding with Hil and Ol in car, Fri. afternoon. Saw folder - it's very good.
stamp: UNITED STATES POSTAGE THOMAS JEFFERSON 1801-1809 3 CENTS 3
